title: Directs commissioner of economic development to make regulations for tourism matching funds program
summary: Authorizes and directs the commissioner of economic development to promulgate regulations governing criteria for the use of tourism matching funds for promoting tourism, resort, vacation, culture and convention activities, replacing annual guidelines therefor.

       AN  ACT  to  amend the economic development law, in relation to deleting
         references to annual guidelines  and  providing  for  promulgation  of
         rules and regulations by the commissioner of economic development

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subdivisions (b) and (c) of section  161  of  the  economic
    2  development  law,  as  amended  by  chapter 465 of the laws of 1981, are
    3  amended to read as follows:
    4     (b) [Establish and publish on an annual basis guidelines]  PROMULGATE
    5  REGULATIONS  relative  to the use of funds to be granted hereunder. Such
    6  [guidelines] REGULATIONS shall [authorize] SPECIFY CRITERIA FOR the  use
    7  of  funds  for the promotion of year round tourist travel, resort, vaca-
    8  tion, culture and convention activities;
    9     (c) Accept or reject applications for matching funds  for  recognized
   10  advertising  programs  by  tourist  promotion  agencies  on the basis of
   11  [annually  published  guidelines]  CRITERIA  SPECIFIED  IN   REGULATIONS
   12  PROMULGATED BY THE COMMISSIONER;
   13    S  2. Subdivisions (b) and (e) of section 164 of the economic develop-
   14  ment law, as amended by chapter 563 of the laws of 1985, are amended  to
   15  read as follows:
   16     (b)  In reviewing such applications, the commissioner may select from
   17  among competing or overlapping applications the application or  applica-
   18  tions  that  the  commissioner  considers  to be of greater benefit to a
   19  given area and the welfare of the people  of  the  state.  Further,  the
   20  commissioner  shall  select from among filed applications those applica-
   21  tions which the commissioner considers to be most  in  accord  with  the

    1  [guidelines established for the fiscal year in which the funds are to be
    2  expended]  CRITERIA  SPECIFIED IN THE REGULATIONS RELATIVE TO THE USE OF
    3  TOURISM MATCHING FUNDS.  If the commissioner determines that an applica-
    4  tion does not meet [the guidelines] SUCH CRITERIA, the tourist promotion

   11  cation.   After review of a submitted  or  resubmitted  application,  if
   12  satisfied that the program of the tourist promotion agency appears to be
   13  in  accord  with  the  purposes  of this [act] ARTICLE, the commissioner

   15  pursuant to this [act] ARTICLE to such tourist promotion agency equal to

   17  tion, provided, however, that such matching grant shall  not  exceed  an
   18  amount  equal to five per centum of the matching grant appropriation for
   19  each county represented by such agency for the  purposes  set  forth  in
   20  this [act] ARTICLE.  Provided that sufficient funds are appropriated, no

   23  by, or committed or subscribed to such tourist promotion agency for  the
   24  purposes  described  in  its application, whichever sum is less. No such

   30  upon  forms  provided  by  the  department.  [Such forms shall contain a

   35    S 3. Subdivision (b) of section 166 of the economic  development  law,
   36  as  added  by  chapter  465  of  the laws of 1981, is amended to read as
   37  follows:
   38     (b) The department shall annually, on or before March  first,  submit
   39  to  the  governor, the temporary president of the senate and the speaker
   40  of the assembly, a report  on  the  activities  of  the  matching  funds
   41  program.  Such  report  shall  include  [a  statement  of the guidelines
   42  promulgated by the department pursuant to section one hundred  sixty-one

   44  department from tourist promotion  agencies,  a  summary  of  activities
   45  conducted  by  the tourist promotion agencies and analyses of the effec-
   46  tiveness of the matching funds program in stimulating tourist  promotion
   47  and  recommendations  concerning the future organization, implementation
   48  and improvement of the matching funds program.
   49    S 4. This act shall take effect on the first of  May  next  succeeding
